newsitem.title: CANADA: Gulf, Conoco set North Dakota oil venture.
newsitem.headline: Gulf, Conoco set North Dakota oil venture.

text.p: Gulf Canada Resources Ltd said on Wednesday it and DuPont Co unit Conoco Inc agreed on a joint venture for multi-zone oil exploration in North Dakota.
The venture includes exploration on all Gulf and Conoco lands in seven townships comprising 161,280 acres, Gulf said.
Under the deal, Gulf will own 60 percent of the venture and Conoco 40 percent.
Prospects in the region include the Lodgepole, Mission Canyon, Red River and Silurian Interlake geological zones.

Conoco, a major developer of North Dakota's Lodgepole exploration play, was slated to drill the first prospect and become operator of joint venture lands in that township after a 3D seidmic program in October.
Gulf said operatorship in other townships would alternate between the companies.
The one well to be drilled this year would cost an estimated US$500,000, it said.
"We both hold significant land in the area, and can benefit frn and exploitation effort," Gulf senior vice-president William Picquet said in a statement. -- Reuters Calgary Bureau 403 531-1624
